TopicTitle: LLL - Lack Luster Labs - Development Thread

Articles.Content:
Updated CBM, with invisible teeth. Works pretty well during my brief testing, how's it work for the rest of you?

Hmmm, I just tried them on 2 existing bits (I figured they the same parts so I not need to redo them)

had a 1.5 deg not alined, and got this result when docked.. (180 to be alined, it was 178.5 just before docking) - so test = fail for me
i would say that's a pretty good alignment, if it can get closer then sure thats good too

Hmmm, I just tried them on 2 existing bits (I figured they the same parts so I not need to redo them)

had a 1.5 deg not alined, and got this result when docked.. (180 to be alined, it was 178.5 just before docking) - so test = fail for me

*snip*

Well, 1.5/180 isn't such a bad error rate. I'll have a bit more of a play with it though.

i would say that's a pretty good alignment, if it can get closer then sure thats good too
Well, 1.5/180 isn't such a bad error rate. I'll have a bit more of a play with it though.

Hehe yea I know it is close and not a bad error rate, if it had been a round docking port etc then it would never be noticed, but since these docking ports have flat sides then it kinda sticks out that it isn't lined up..

I know I am probably being picky, but it would be nice if it could snap into an exact alinement if you are only a couple of degrees out

Thought i'd show off my Part LLL Rover Lander which i managed to get to Duna, Barely.

Where are those solar panels from?

Omni Wheels make it possible for me to lower and raise the rover...

Which also means redocking with the lander is a lot easier!

If you'd like to witness some unfortunate events which occured afterwards, Use this link

http://imgur.com/a/7prnu

'Definately' not caused by my bad piloting >.>

Where are those solar panels from?

Erecting a base!

Cried a little when I realised I had forgotten the docking ports on the other side.

Where are those solar panels from?

The IonHybrid Electric Pack from spaceport adds larger solar panels, batteries and a large RTG. They're really helpful.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-18-ion-engine-pack/

Erecting a base!

Nice job and i know the feeling when you forget something important like a docking port

Where on the Mun is this (coords) ? The steep cliffs seem liek a nice place to set up base.

Nice job and i know the feeling when you forget something important like a docking port

Where on the Mun is this (coords) ? The steep cliffs seem liek a nice place to set up base.

To be honest I just reinstalled since I wanted a fresh game before I continued.

The inclination is roughly zero and it's clearly visible from orbit. It's quite long and looks like grand canyon.
Amazing work! Please keep chugging out parts for the rest of us!

To be honest I just reinstalled since I wanted a fresh game before I continued.

The inclination is roughly zero and it's clearly visible from orbit. It's quite long and looks like grand canyon.

Alright, cool. Thanks!

Amazing work! Please keep chugging out parts for the rest of us!

I can see by your total posts that you also registered on the forum because of how magnificent this pack is
I'm liking the newer big hull parts. This needed something like that.

I just reinstalled this pack, love these parts!

Noticed the 'Docking Lights' are gone...am I just missing it or did it get taken out? Its silly, but I really likes that part, used it on a lot of builds.

I just reinstalled this pack, love these parts!

Noticed the 'Docking Lights' are gone...am I just missing it or did it get taken out? Its silly, but I really likes that part, used it on a lot of builds.

They should still be there, under the Utility tab, although they don't really have an icon in the menu (since the part extends to be quite large). I've checked and they are in 0.09.9, are you sure you didn't just miss them?

@Tw1 and Cuel,

Wow, those are pretty darn cool.

I'm liking the newer big hull parts. This needed something like that.
